items.editorNote: Early polls reveal Americans are deeply divided on the U.S. military operation capturing Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, with only about one-third overall support and sharp partisan splits.
keyPoints: A Reuters/Ipsos poll found only 33% of Americans approved the U.S. strike, while 72% feared excessive U.S. involvement in Venezuela.
Republicans showed strong support at 65%, contrasting with just 11% of Democrats and 23% of independents backing the operation.
YouGov surveys reflected similar partisan divides, with 66% of Republicans supporting military force versus 14% of Democrats.
Americans were almost evenly split on the operation’s impact: 34% believed it would improve Venezuela’s situation, 35% thought it would worsen it.
